body: resolved
How are you viewing that page? Are you viewing it by running "make serve"?
`make serve` makes no difference.
close since I am dumb and don't RTFM
The code block formatting also not working for me. But @kramasamy seems has an working version
@objmagic What do you mean by cannot be rendered? Do you mean that it isn't showing up or only that the syntax highlighting isn't working?
@lucperkins only syntax highlighting isn't working. code block is displayed as plain text
Code block sometimes does not work for some people. Not sure why is that.

@objmagic @kramasamy Try experimenting with other [Pygments themes](https://github.com/richleland/pygments-css). To select a different one, simply change the `pygmentsStyle` config in `website/config.yaml`. This is simply the one I selected when I was first working on the project and I have no problem with changing it. Just let me know if one ends up working better (in general) than others.
:shipit:
Another alternative can be: start a monit process for every executor and restart the executor if it fails.
Thanks @saileshmittal!
@objmagic sounds good. Please do so and this can be closed out. You can open another ticket for removing the warnings.

@objmagic @kramasamy I've tried this out with a variety of different Pygments themes and as far as I can tell YAML highlighting doesn't seem to work in any of them. I think this is something we'll need to come back to later.
@lucperkins - I was wondering if you could send some screen shots of the new website.
@maosongfu - can you review this and see if this can be checked in?
@lucperkins - Has all the feedback been addressed?

Yes, it has. Feel free to merge.

Looks good to me
@lucperkins seems that `javadocs.sh` in this commit didn't use my commited version on master. Is Javadocs problem gone now? Do warnings still exist?
@objmagic My apologies. Not sure how that happened. I've re-added those lines to the script in the most recent commit.

I also took the liberty of adding a 404 page:

https://www.dropbox.com/s/kikmxtnzxgpu5hl/heron-404.png?dl=0
@ashvina Could you let me know when this lands? I'd love to add documentation for this and also use this as potential material for the "Custom Schedulers" doc.
@lucperkins thanks, but it would be good if we can also figure out how to remove warnings emitted by `javadocs.sh`

To be honest, I'm not really sure that there's much we can do. The only way
I can think of to remove all those errors would be to actually import the
Protobuf Java library into the Heron codebase itself, and I'm not sure
that's really worth it. Right now there _are_ Javadocs errors but until it
can be shown that they actually make a difference in readers' experience of
the docs I'm strongly inclined to think that it's of very minor importance.

@lucperkins - we are planning to get this one as soon as we can. @maosongfu - are we ready to get this  in?

Overall it looks fine but I have few suggestions. 
- The collapsible side navigation bar is gone this might be useful for people reading on phones or tablets 
- The list text seem way too small on all of the documentation pages - for example on "Getting Started" heron-client-install and heron-tools-install are very small and hard to read
- Can the tweets list be extended to stretch down close to the footer?

I'll see what I can do re: issues 2 and 3. Re: issue 1, the collapsible
navigation bar is still there, but it only shows up on smaller screens (as
it was previously). You can adjust your browser window to see the effect.

Just reviewed the code. @ashvina Did u try this reef scheduler with a distibured environment inside microsoft?

in order to get syntax highlighting while rendering locally - you should do 

```
pip install Pigments
```
Syntax highlighting works fine now, and this PR lgtm. We can merge it now.

One needs to do

``` Bash
$ pip install Pygments
```

to see syntax highlighting when developing locally.

Thanks @cckellogg and we can close this issue now.
see PR #734
@lucperkins and @billonahill - I was wondering if this is fixed. If you any additional help, @bmhatfield can pitch in?

I'm happy to pitch in on this but I wanted to wait to make sure that other
documentation work isn't currently underway (as that can create a lot of
merge headaches). Let me know when you feel like it's safe to begin making
changes and I'll get these fixed quickly.

@kramasamy this is blocked on #346 which is to get the developer docs written and properly linked. Those are the last of the broken links. @nlu90 are you working on #346?

Overall styles look good to me.

Only comment I have is that the bullet text has always seemed kinda huge to me. See the `heron-client-install-<version>-darwin.sh` on the getting started page (which should be fixed-width code formatted IMO too btw).
+1 for what @lucperkins said.

+1, I agree let's not get into that fixed-width stuff on this PR.

Those bullet sizes look fine. In https://www.dropbox.com/s/iay0o8c5vqmd266/heron-docs-page.png?dl=0 the size difference between regular text and bullet text is more pronounced.
@billonahill Totally agree, but fortunately that screenshot you linked is from an earlier commit 😄

Yeah, @saileshmittal we need to move to standard zookeepers style, also what current java part supports:
zk-host1:port1, zk-host2:port2, ....
https://zookeeper.apache.org/doc/r3.4.6/api/org/apache/zookeeper/ZooKeeper.html#ZooKeeper(java.lang.String, int, org.apache.zookeeper.Watcher)

connectString - comma separated host:port pairs, each corresponding to a zk server. e.g. "127.0.0.1:3000,127.0.0.1:3001,127.0.0.1:3002" If the optional chroot suffix is used the example would look like: "127.0.0.1:3000,127.0.0.1:3001,127.0.0.1:3002/app/a" where the client would be rooted at "/app/a" and all paths would be relative to this root - ie getting/setting/etc... "/foo/bar" would result in operations being run on "/app/a/foo/bar" (from the server perspective).
@saileshmittal - any update on this?

https://github.com/twitter/heron/blob/master/website/content/docs/developers/data-model.md#L6 also references spouts.html and bolts.html and should be updated.

Please run the following to verify all links are good:
`cd website && make site`

Also please change the ';' to an "&&" to enable link checks here:
https://github.com/twitter/heron/blob/master/.travis.yml#L52
bad links should be gone after #734, #738, #739
btw, numbering under _Patch Acceptance Process_ on page heron/docs/contributors/community/ is wrong
Could u merge with latest master branch and fix the travis-ci building too?

@alanngai We use 2 space indent. Could you change your setting to take that into account? It will decrease the diff length quite a bit.

Also, please try to create multiple PRs for different modules, so it will be easier to review.

ok.  I was just going by whatever the checkstyle rules was configured.  Should I change the rules?  There are also some fairly stringent rules regarding line length and exception catching scope.  Should I change those as well?

> On May 23, 2016, at 5:05 PM, Sailesh Mittal notifications@github.com wrote:
> 
> @alanngai https://github.com/alanngai We use 2 space indent. Could you change your setting to take that into account? It will decrease the diff length quite a bit.
> 
> Also, please try to create multiple PRs for different modules, so it will be easier to review.
> 
> —
> You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub https://github.com/twitter/heron/pull/735#issuecomment-221131269

Yes, please go ahead and change the rules.
1. Indentation to 2 spaces
2. Ignore imports. This is because of the way bazel and pex work. The imports have to have the scope starting from root directory of project.
3. Ignore Exception rules. Most python code is lenient on exceptions.
4. Length should be 100 chars per line. We need to fix them if they are violated.
5. Unused params should be deleted.

Please create issues for the parts of codes that are not straightforward.

If you know how to enable these checks based on modules (cli or tracker or ui or common), we should enable it selectively for those that have been taken care of. Otherwise we'll enable once everything is compliant.
Sure - as long as we don't break the storm compatibility and not breaking the running code - I am fine.

Will do.  Regarding #5, deleting parameters will alter the the api.  For example, in heron/cli/src/python/activate.py:46
def run(command, parser, cl_args, unknown_args):
‘parser’ and ‘unknown_args’ are unused, but if I remove them, I’d change the function definition, and potentially break places that uses this function.  I see 3 options
1. refactor all usages of this function and change the way they call this.  This option is dangerous because I don’t know all the areas that use this, and because of duck typing, I may not be able to find all usages even with the help of and IDE
2. change the checkstyle rules to ignore unused function params.  don’t know how to do this yet, I assume there’s a way
3. redefine the function to use underscores in place of the unused params (see below).  looks pretty ugly to me, but it’s an option
   def run(command, _, cl_args, _):
   If you could point me to where the checkstyle config is that would be much appreciated.

Thanks,
Alan
